## Interactive Elements
The user has some elements available in the web application which he can interact with. The configuration the user selects with those elements will dynamically generate a graph in the "Plot" tab:

<table>
<tr><th>Sidebar panel (Input)</th><th>Tabset panel (View)</th>
<tr><td><ul>
<li>Slider (Sample/Size)</li>
<li>X,Y axes variables</li>
<li>Color variable</li>
<li>Facets variables</li>
<li>Jitter</li>
<li>Smooth</li></ul>
</td>
<td>
<li>Documentation</li>
<li>Dynamic Plot</li>

</td></tr></table>

## Data Visualization: Shiny plot examples

```{r echo=FALSE, cache=TRUE, warning=FALSE,fig.height=4,fig.width=15,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(vcdExtra)
data(Baseball)
p <- ggplot(Baseball, aes_string(x='atbat86', y='hits86')) + geom_point()
p <- p + aes_string(color='league86')
p <- p + geom_jitter()
p <- p + geom_smooth()
print(p)
```

```{r opts.label = 'interactive', results = 'asis', echo=FALSE, cache=TRUE, fig.height=4,fig.width=15,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
p <- ggplot(Baseball, aes_string(x='homer86', y='runs86')) + geom_point()
p <- p + aes_string(color='div86')
facets <- paste('.', '~', 'league86')
p <- p + facet_grid(facets)
p <- p + geom_jitter()
p <- p + geom_smooth()
print(p)
```
